result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone K Allen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrone K Allen in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Tyrone K Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant in compliance with the terms of the agreement. In order to receive the benefits of the agreement, the defendant needs to complete the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and filed

Defendant Tyrone K Allen in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Davis, Branch 21 for a review hearing.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrone K Allen in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrone K Allen appeared by video means with Attorney. Case in court for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Court ordered stayed bench warrant cancelled. Defendant not in position to proceed with today's hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution hearing in Branch 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
and Addendum, received and filed.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement, received and filed.
received and filed.

Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone K Allen in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrone K Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense has received discovery and will receive an offer from the state.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3-23-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Tyrone K Allen in court.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/21/22 @ 1:30p
